highlights: Delivered feature “Historical Revisions for Database Metadata” to enable data rollbacks and audit trails to close a $300K stalled deal.
Reduced time and cost complexity within Tableau infrastructure by migrating role- and attribute-based access controls.
Persuaded customers to substitute their in-house row-level security solution with a turn-key solution provided by Tableau with the intention of alleviating system resources.
Increased partner engagement on enterprise deals by 1% by delivering educational content, such as webinars, hackathons, whiteboarding sessions, and speaking engagements.
Improved partner competency by 4% by developing curricula and authoring exams for Salesforce’s cloud offerings.
Collaborated with OEM partner Tanium and Salesforce Product Management teams in the creation of an ITSM solution to address the rapid expansion of a competitor.
Evangelized Heroku at a large telecommunications company with an entrenched AWS base by uncovering use cases where Heroku would seamlessly complement the Salesforce Platform.
Demonstrated a POC to the CTO of a large casino by swapping TIBCO’s Enterprise Messaging Service with a Heroku Kafka cluster and in turn reduced the TCO for a group of services by 11%.

Promoted the usage of Heroku Postgres as a single source of truth for a multinational media conglomerate by demonstrating a POC to synchronize 5 million records across 8 Salesforce instances in under 20 minutes with conflict resolution implemented.

highlights: Architected a fan-out service to democratize revenue data for financial analysts closing a $2M deal.

Educated customers on how to migrate computationally intensive processes off the Salesforce Platform onto Heroku, such as implementing recursive roll-ups, CPQ calculations, transformations, enrichment, cleansing, dimensionality reduction and proxying using NodeJS and Heroku compute units.

Fundamentals of JavaScript: values, types, operators, precedence, coercion, functions, first-class citizens, objects, arrays, (weak) sets, (weak) maps, higher-order functions, scope, closures, promises, asynchrony, paradigms, prototypical inheritance, variable hoisting, and API design.

Server-side development: multi-tier architecture, authentication strategies, RESTful API design, JS, Express, Networking, Wireshark, HTTP, CORS, Postgres, MongoDB, ORMs, BASH, MVC, Proxies, CDNs, SQL, SSR, templating, TLS, and Docker.

Client-side development: HTML, CSS, JS, DOM API, Chrome Dev Tools, browser events, browser networking, React, JSX, specificity, component lifecycle, Webpack, props system, pure & impure components, React state, React Router, Redux, Redux-Saga, isomorphism, transpilation, BootStrap 3/4, jQuery, axios, fetch.

Fundamentals of data science: perceptron, gradient descent, adaptive linear neurons, logistic regression, classifiers (scikit learn), decision trees, random forests, principal component analysis, linear discriminant analysis, principal components analysis, k-fold cross-validation, clustering analysis, convolutional neural network, recurrent neural network.

Programmatically relayed food order placements from OrderWell to Eat24 and DoorDash to create a unified experience across multiple food ordering applications.
Created a CMS for managing restaurant and meal data used by business development to quickly onboard restaurant chains and improve quality.
Built and internally promoted a proof of concept for an online video player using Webpack, BackboneJS, VideoJS, and FreeWheel that later became the basis of the company’s core technology.
Created a web application that would ephemerally inject themed video players on publisher's pages for testing purposes, eliminating the need to conduct lengthy pre-sales PoCs.
Programmatically analyzed biometric patterns for identifying publishers affected by non-human traffic and reconciled with reports generated by ad servers to project true revenue potentials.
